column1: Smoque BBQ////The best BBQ I've had north of the Mason-Dixon line.  Period.  And quite a bit better than much if it south.  Others have complained about them running out of food
column2: which has disappointed us once or twice
column3: but that also is an indication of HOW they cook their meat
column4: "low and slow."  You can't produce good BBQ fast.  I crave the sliced brisket - literally melt-in-your-mouth -  while my husband goes for the pulled pork (my sandwich choice if I am in the neighborhood at lunchtime).  This may not count as health food for the body
column5: but it sure is health food for the soul.
